intro: Agrostemma brachylobum, commonly known as the short-stalked honesty, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, and its seed pods split open to release tiny, white seeds. Agrostemma brachylobum is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. It is also known for its historical use in herbal medicine.
